main_definition: Floor refers to the surface of a room or building that people walk on, as well as various idiomatic expressions related to leveling up, downgrading, etc.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The bottom surface of a room or building upon which one stands
meanings_and_examples.example: She dropped her phone on the floor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To forcefully remove someone from a position, often in politics or business
meanings_and_examples.example: When the board decided to floor him as CEO after he lost popularity among shareholders.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A level of quality or degree in a system, especially regarding grades and education
meanings_and_examples.example: The fifth grade is considered middle school in some regions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To endorse or support someone or something enthusiastically
meanings_and_examples.example: I'm all for this new initiative, I will floor it!
